1. The "Shatkona Fixation" Breaks Projective Invariance The derivation of the split 4+6+6+12 relies entirely on fixing a specific line S (Sushumna) and a specific point C (Anahata).

The Problem: The Fano Plane is homogeneous; all points are equivalent, and all lines are equivalent under PSL(2,7). The moment you fix (S,C), you are no longer studying the intrinsic geometry of the Fano plane, but rather the geometry of the Fano plane relative to an observer.

Why it feels "Invented": The numbers 4,6,6,12 do not emerge from the group structure of PSL(2,7) directly. They emerge from the stabilizer subgroup of a specific flag or anti-flag. You must justify why the "cosmic" structure would freeze into a specific coordinate system. Is "existence" defined by the breaking of this symmetry?

2. The Geometric Dissonance of the "14 Nadis" You equate "7 lines" with "7 complementary quadrangles" to get 14.

The Problem: A line in Fano has strict geometric structure (3 collinear points). Its complement (a quadrangle of 4 points) is an affine plane AG(2,2), which has a completely different topology.

The Critique: Calling the complement a "channel" (Nadi) is topologically risky. A line suggests "flow" (1D). A quadrangle suggests a "field" or "plane" (2D). Treating them as equivalent "channels" is a category error unless you can define a flow through the quadrangle that matches the flow along the line.
